required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this observational program is to generate data on the use of Tredaptive (nicotinic acid/laropiprant) for lipid management under routine medical practice conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Lipid Panel Control
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Visit 1 entrance evaluation (Week 0) to Visit 2 (between Weeks 8-22)
primary_outcome.description: Lipid Panel Control was defined as achieving target for one or more of the following parameters: low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) at goal (<100mg/dL), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) within normal range (40mg/dL for males and 50mg/dL for females), and/or triglycerides within normal range (≤ 150mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported Adverse Events

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients treated within a disease management program
arm_group.description: Participant prescribed Tredaptive® for dyslipidemia and also participated in a disease management program for treatment of diabetes mellitus, coronary heart disease or both.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients treated outside a disease management program
arm_group.description: Participant prescribed Tredaptive® for dyslipidemia and did not participate in a disease management program for treatment of diabetes mellitus, coronary heart disease or both.

study_pop.textblock: Patients in routine medical care either statutorily health insured or privately insured

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients are 18 years of age or older with lipid disorder treated with nicotinic acid/laropiprant
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is currently participating in a clinical trial

group.title: All Evaluable Participants
group.description: Participants who were prescribed Tredaptive® for the treatment of dyslipidemia and primary hypercholesterolemia as per the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) by his/her primary physician in a routine clinical setting either within or outside a Disease Management Program (DMP).

group.title: Intent-to-Treat Population
group.description: Baseline characteristics were reported for the 2359 participants in the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population, which included all participants from the Evaluable Population who began therapy at or after Visit 1. The ITT Population excluded 31 of the 2390 evaluable participants who began treatment prior to Visit 1.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Age data was missing 13 of the 2359 participants in the ITT Population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Lipid Panel Control
outcome.description: Lipid Panel Control was defined as achieving target for one or more of the following parameters: low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) at goal (<100mg/dL), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) within normal range (40mg/dL for males and 50mg/dL for females), and/or triglycerides within normal range (≤ 150mg/dL).
outcome.time_frame: From Visit 1 entrance evaluation (Week 0) to Visit 2 (between Weeks 8-22)
outcome.population: Results are for the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population. Information regarding the participation in a disease management program was not reported for 63 participants in the ITT Population.

group.title: Patients Treated Within a Disease Management Program
group.description: Participant prescribed Tredaptive® for dyslipidemia and also participated in a disease management program for treatment of diabetes mellitus, coronary heart disease or both.

group.title: Patients Treated Outside a Disease Management Program
group.description: Participant prescribed Tredaptive® for dyslipidemia and did not participate in a disease management program for treatment of diabetes mellitus, coronary heart disease or both.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Lipid Panel Control
measure.description: Lipid Panel Control was defined as achieving target for one or more of the following parameters: low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) at goal (<100mg/dL), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) within normal range (40mg/dL for males and 50mg/dL for females), and/or triglycerides within normal range (≤ 150mg/dL).
measure.population: Results are for the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population. Information regarding the participation in a disease management program was not reported for 63 participants in the ITT Population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Reported Adverse Events

group.title: All Evaluable Participants
group.description: Participants who were prescribed Tredaptive® for the treatment of dyslipidemia and primary hypercholesterolemia as per the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) by his/her primary physician in a routine clinical setting either within or outside a Disease Management Program (DMP).

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Reported Adverse Events

group.title: All Evaluable Participants
group.description: Participants who were prescribed Tredaptive® for the treatment of dyslipidemia and primary hypercholesterolemia as per the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) by his/her primary physician in a routine clinical setting either within or outside a Disease Management Program (DMP).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: MSD SHARP & DOHME GmbH and its comarketing companies have exclusive rights to the use and evaluation of the data collected in this study.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
